metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23094 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
Libreswan 4.2 through 4.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via a crafted IKEv1packet because pluto/ikev1.c wrongly expects that a state object exists.This is fixed in 4.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libreswan - 4.7-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libreswan package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.7-1ubuntu1').
